Player History
Drafted in 8th round, 156th overall pick, by Baltimore in 1965...
Released by Baltimore on 4/23/1967...
Drafted in 1st round, 1st overall pick, by Los Angeles in 1968...
Injured on 6/7/1968 with a Tight Knee, out for one week...
Injured on 4/2/1969 with a Inflamed Thigh Muscle, out for one week...
Injured on 7/7/1970 with a Strained Hamstring Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from Los Angeles to Philadelphia on 1/31/1971 (Going to PHI: RF G. Foster, 1B J. Mayberry Sr., P J. Strohmayer. Going to LA: P P. Richert)...
Had first career hit on 5/24/1971, off Gene Brabender (HOU)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/15/1971, off Bob Moose (PIT)...
Traded from Philadelphia to San Francisco on 5/5/1976 (Going to SF: RF G. Foster. Going to PHI: LF J. Royster, LF H. Washington, 2B G. Pryor)...
Drove in 6 runs against Atlanta on 7/14/1976...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1976, hitting .407 with 6 HR, 19 RBI...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1978...
